comment: First query today, about 20 lines of project requirements to build a browser extension. Plan mode with Claude Opus 4.5 refuses to work saying "ooops" I have reached my token limit. Sorry, but this is just as bad as JetBrains' AI assistant, only that it spies on our customers' data while still not producing helpful code even in the paid plan version.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The difference between the VS Code and Android Studio plugins is huge. If I leave the model on automatic, it chooses Sonnet and uses up all my credits because when I send the prompt, it keeps calculating and doesn't return or do anything, besides all the unnecessary hallucinations. It doesn't remember my prompts and invents things. I'm wasting a lot of money on this and I don't even get any compensation for it. I'm very disappointed. And I'm still trying to use some OpenIA model (having the ApiKey) and I only get error messages or messages saying that I've reached the limit.

It authenticates successfully in the browser but nothing happens in the IDE.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Latest version does not work with GitHUB Enterprise products, authentication fails because it mixes github and ghe addresses. The configured server-name is not used. Bugs are opened and a reference to last years version is recommended, but it won't work since last years version is no longer API compatible and cannot be installed. Will review if fixed...

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I dont get all the negative reviews. Ok, sure It's not perfect yet, but it keeps improving steadily, and the last week I have been using it without issues, the agent mode is now really good and stable and helping me increase my productivity by a factor of 2-3. To the developers: Don't be discouraged, keep up the good work!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The basic functionality is there, so it warrants 1 or 2 stars, but this plugin is sadly so far behind in terms of stability and usability and has too many bugs when compared to plugins in other IDEs that this might be finally the reason to switch over from CLion to VS Code. Editing your prompt often gets it deleted by pressing Ctrl-Shift-Left to select the current line but selects the whole text, scrolling up in the first line brings back the previous prompt with no way to get back to the one you currently type, Agents defined in the appropriate .md files don't show up, local MCP servers do not work AT ALL (for WEEKS! now without fix) -- you can define them, but no tools are discovered and they cannot be used.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
If I compare the planning mode in VSCode and Webstorm, for some reason Webstorm immediately displays a sample code it's implementing, even though planning mode isn't designed to display code.

Often, during planning mode, the AI ​​will say something like "I don't have access to editing tools" and start dumbly outputting the implementation as text instead of creating a plan.

It's also annoying that when I press Shift + CMD + Left, instead of selecting a line (like in VSCode or any other text window), it selects the entire text. This is incredibly inconvenient when you want to edit a single line of a prompt, not the entire prompt. This wasn't the case in earlier versions of the plugin.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Awful experience, which is worsening every update. It doesn't worth it, even if it was for free.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Awful. Use Claude.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Its worst and worst, after last update it freezes intellij idea, so I must disable it for some time...

comment: It sometimes works.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The plugin lags far behind when compared with other AI plugins / IDEs

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I don't really have a strong opinion one way or the other on this plugin yet. I'm only using the free tier and testing it out...

However, there is one highly annoying thing about it. It adds this "generate code review" option to the top of the context menu (intention actions, maybe) where "Declare explicit type" is usually placed at the top. This is destroying my flow. I have looked for a way to turn that option off, either completely or just remove it from the menu, and there doesn't appear to be one.

On another point, it set at least one keyboard shortcut that trampled an existing one. I went to run a test with coverage using ctrl+shift+c (which I've had in place for ages), and I got the Copilot chat instead. So I changed Copilot to ctrl+opt+cmd+c because that's entirely unused and not even close to another IDE shortcut.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: stopped working in the latest version

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: With every update, it gets worse and worse, especially in agent mode.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Be careful; agent mode will read your sensitive env files and send secret keys to in your chats. The include file toggle always turns itself back on constantly.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: All bad reviews are right. Add one funny complaint more: DEL key does not work ìn the prompt box (you only have BackSpace to fix your typing errors). "CTRL+Enter" or similar method to break paragraphs without submitting also doesn't work.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The same integration in other IDEs works largely better. I spend more time asking the agent to read its instructions than doing actual work.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Don't bother with Chat or Agent mode. It's broken and they're clearly strapped for resources to fix it properly so all they do is play pretend while adding more bugs to the pile while the experience is just plain bad. Yelling here or reporting issues is just waste of time and energy as they're completely ignored despite the developers asking you to spend your time sending them.

Either switch to VSC or use OpenCode for the agent more and keep this plugin only for autocomplete. That's the only remaining good part and I get a feeling it's because they haven't touched it in a while.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The output is unusable because of the formatting.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It’s really bad. Apart from GPT being meh, the UI/UX of this trash is horrible. If you are epileptic, you will get an attack. It’s really, really resource-intensive and very unstable.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
This last update made the application unstable.

When switching from Ask mode to Agent Mode you lose access to the history. The new working set functionality is clunky compared to the previous iteration. the agent no longer intrinsicly has access to the code and can't properly update dependencies of files it editted if it's not explicitly in the working set and will add new files outside the projects src folder. It is not even able to search the project for similar files even when explicitly prompted not to create new files.

this make it nearly unusable

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The very first plugin I'm unable to use in 10 years of jetbrains ecosystem: the login is ficky, unusable in remote environment, completion window is a mess, both in terms of UX and lack of proposed content. Microsoft efforts in providing a plugin for a concurrent IDE of theirs is a joke.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The tool give mixed feelings. It is helpful. but also really poor. On many occasions it doen's follow the intsructions. It imagines code and files and provides comments about things that do not exist. Which is a waste of time and credits.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Rider.

Adding API key for OpenAI and using GPT5.2* yields an error:

Sorry, an error occurred while generating a response. Details: unhandled status from server: 400 { "error": { "message": "Unsupported value: 'temperature' does not support 0 with this model. Only the default (1) value is supported.", "type": "invalid_request_error", "param": "temperature", "c... Read more from logs. Request ID:********

  • including mini and nano

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: There have been far too many bugs over the past six months. Are you also using AI to write your code?

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Since upgrading to version 1.5.63-243, memory usage grows until it consumes all 32 GB plus swap and pegs the CPU (Core i7, 12 cores). If I’m not fast enough to kill copilot-language-server, the whole OS freezes and I have to hard power off the laptop.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Useful only for stupidly simple tasks, like generating some comments maybe extrapolation of arrays where this plugin can guess the next possible values (which it is also terrible at, BTW).

When it comes to generating code, it's good only for disposable scripts where you don't care about the code quality and just want to get to the results faster. So expect surprises and some weird, repetitive, and inefficient solutions.

Very often, fighting with the plugin to get what you need turns takes 10x more time than writing it yourself.

It doesn't understand the context, it generates complete b*shit out of nowhere, and of course, it always "knows" what you need by suggesting a complete nonsense. The lags are also horrible. You expect it to generate code for you when you need it -> it does nothing. You poke it, poke again -> nothing. Then, when you don't need it, it generates and autocompletes your code with some totally illogical crap that you have to delete.

Super annoying!

And I honestly have a feeling it was better when it first came out than it is today.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: it sucks

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Not usable

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
It's improved, but not perfect. The text in the prompt input field is single-line, meaning you can't select a line by pressing CMD + A; the entire area is selected. This didn't happen in earlier versions, and it doesn't exist in VS Code. Files referenced by the AI ​​can't be opened by clicking on them; an error occurs.

Can you tell me if I launch "Plan" mode, do subagents launch? Because there's no indication of this anywhere during agent execution (unlike in VS Code).

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Completely useless... Every time I try to use this plugin, it crashes and displays a warning message. Close the IDE, restart it, and you can use the plugin. After half an hour? It crashes again. Updates almost every day and still the same errors. Amazing for a paid service.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Now, it's way better

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Only after migrating to VS Code's plugin I've realized how far behind Pycharm's is - poor performance, "unknown" errors, poor UI, and unusable when working with WSL. Until this plugin is fixed from the bottom, I can't see myself ever use it again.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Not usable... I prefer the UI of PyCharm, but this plugin has so many bugs: Agent mode fails to scan files, write scripts... it's impossible to have an agent running snippets on the command line.

Basically, this is a differentiator in favour of VSCode. I find myself editing code on VSCode with GitHub Copilot and then using the interface of PyCharm. It is not sustainable... Either JetBrains steps into this, or eventually they are going to loose the customers because of this plugin being so faulty.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: "So disgustingly good that it made me abandon my precious GoLand subscription and crawl back to VS Code like a humble peasant. Thanks for saving me money, I guess."
